request.description:
API documentation for LibrairieNumérique

lazyloading api, how it works?

the lazyloading api is used to manage different kind of reading operation, such as filtering, pagination, order by a parameter and so on.

To enalbe lazyloading, you must specify the parameter dfilters=true and then give the attribut with following nomenclatura :

attributname:opt=value

attributname can be: 
- the attribut of the current class ex: name:eq=value
- the attribut of an imbricate class following the nomenclatura: entity.attribute:opt=value ex: category.name:eq=acategory

opt can be:
- eq : =
- lt : <
- gt : >
- get: >=
- let: <=
- lkl: like %value
- lkr: like value%
- btw: between (). for this option, value is specified as value1_value2 the '_' makes the separation between value1 and value2

if none of those possible value of opt is specified, the request will be traited with operator like %value% by default

example:
let's have the class book_library:{id, stock, book:{name, price, ..., category:{}}, library: {id, name, ...}}

find a book of a specific library with id or name
 request
 - with id: {{prod_url}}book-library&dfilters=on&library.id:eq=5
 - with name: {{prod_url}}book-library&dfilters=on&library.id:opt=name
 - ordering by book id desc: {{prod_url}}book-library&dfilters=on&order=book.id desc

to handle pagination you need 2 paramters: next and per_page those parameter work together (the dfilters is optional if you are just doing pagination without any other kind of filtering)

example:
let's have this request: go to the 5th page of book-library a print 20 element per page
- {{prod_url}}book-library&next=5&per_page=20
